articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits New Pyongyang Corn Processing Factory
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits New Pyongyang Corn Processing Factory
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, provided field guidance to the newly-built Pyongyang Corn Processing Factory.
					 Enjoying a bird's-eye view of the factory, he said with pleasure that one of the behests of leader Kim Jong Il, who had put all his heart and energies into improving the citizens' diet, was implemented as the factory has taken its shape amid a vigorous drive for creating a new Pyongyang spirit, Pyongyang speed.
					
					 He went round various production processes of the factory and its product show room, combined control room, rooms for sci-tech knowledge and experiment and analysis, gymnasium, etc. to learn in detail about its construction and production.
					
					 He expressed satisfaction over the fact that the factory has widened the variety of processed corn products such as noodle, meal, cake, bread and sweet jelly and raised the level of packing.
					
					 He also highly appreciated the sci-tech knowledge room, built to ensure tele-education, and the gymnasium.
					
					 Saying that the factory has an important mission to tangibly contribute to improving the diet of Pyongyangites, he indicated the tasks and ways facing the factory. What it should do is to turn out a variety of processed corn products in a larger quantity by keeping the production going at a high rate, take a proper measure for supply of raw materials and meticulously carry on business administration, pay special heed to thoroughly guaranteeing the hygienic safety and quality of products and make all its products popular among the people.
					
					 He praised the Pyongyangites for their sincere assistance to the construction of the factory and the officials, teachers and researchers of Kim Il Sung University, Kim Chaek University of Technology, Pyongyang University of Mechanical Engineering and Pyongyang Han Tok Su University of Light Industry for their significant contribution to its modernization.
					
					 Then he had a photo session with the officials and employees of the factory, expressing belief that they would work hard to add eternal glory to the warm love shown by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il for the people.
					
					 Accompanying him were Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Yang Gon and Jo Yong Won.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Uzbekistan
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Uzbekistan 
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Islam Karimov, president of Uzbekistan, on the occasion of its national day.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly relations between the DPRK and Uzbekistan would favorably develop in the interests of the peoples of the two countries and wished the Uzbek president success in his responsible work for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Leaves
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Nippon Sport Science University led by Managing Director Kenshiro Matsunami left here for home on Tuesday.

articles.title: Anniversary of Diplomatic Ties between DPRK and Cuba Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Diplomatic Ties between DPRK and Cuba Marked 
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- There took place a meeting at the Chollima Hall of Culture on Tuesday to mark the 55th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and the Republic of Cuba. 
					 Invited to the meeting were German Hermin Ferras Alvarez, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy. 
					
					 Present there were Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission who is chairman of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba, Sin Hong Chol, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, officials concerned and citizens. 
					
					 Kim Sung Du in his speech said the Cuban people have firmly protected the sovereignty of the country and successfully pushed forward the revolution and construction despite the U.S. persistent moves to isolate and stifle Cuba under the correct leadership of respected Comrades Fidel Castro Ruz and Raul Castro Ruz. 
					
					 He said that the Korean people will as ever regard the Cuban people as the close comrades-in-arms standing together in the forefront of the struggle against imperialism and the U.S. and work hard to further develop the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries. 
					
					 The Cuban ambassador in his speech said President Kim Il Sung extended unsparing support and encouragement to Cuba at the crisis of Caribbean Sea. He noted that the friendly relations between the two countries forged and developed by the preceding leaders are further developing thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 He hoped that the Korean people will attain the goals for building a thriving nation and achieve the reunification of the country and that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries will further develop.

articles.title: Room Built at Cuban Embassy in Pyongyang to House Car Sent by Kim Il Sung as Gift
articles.content:
Room Built at Cuban Embassy in Pyongyang to House Car Sent by Kim Il Sung as Gift
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- A room was built at the Cuban embassy here to house a car sent by President Kim Il Sung as a gift.
					 Kim Il Sung who paid deep attention to the development of the friendly relations with the Cuban people sent the car to the first Cuban ambassador to the DPRK as a gift in Juche 51 (1962).
					
					 In order to hand down his noble internationalist obligation, the Cuban government made sure that the car was preserved at the embassy in its original state on the occasion of the Day of the Sun in 1999.
					
					 The embassy has preserved the car so far with much care and built a room for housing the car this year, the 55th anniversary of the establishment of the diplomatic relations between the two countries, true to the intention of the government and the people of Cuba attaching great importance to the development of the traditional friendly relations with the DPRK.
					
					 An inaugural ceremony took place on Monday.
					
					 Present there on invitation were DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong, Pak Kun Gwang, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Sim Kuk Ryong, general director of the General Bureau for Affairs with Diplomatic Corps, So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and officials concerned.
					
					 On hand were German Hermin Ferras Alvarez, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 The ambassador in a speech said that the room serves as a symbol of the particularly close friendship and solidarity between Cuba and the DPRK.
					
					 He expressed belief that the car would be permanently preserved at the embassy to show younger generation the indestructibility of the friendly relations between the two countries.
					
					 The participants looked round the car.

articles.title: Ryongsan Youth Power Station Goes Operational
articles.content:
Ryongsan Youth Power Station Goes Operational
						
 Pukchang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The Ryongsan Youth Power Station went operational with due ceremony on Tuesday.
					 The construction of the power station provided a foundation for contributing to the economic development and improvement of the people's living standard in South Phyongan Province. 
					
					 Present there were Pak Thae Song, chief secretary of the South Phyongan Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned, shock brigade members and employees of the power station.
					
					 Read out was a message of thanks the C.C., the WPK sent to members of the youth shock brigade, builders and officials who performed labor feats in the construction of the power station.
					
					 The message said that leader Kim Jong Il set forth a militant task of paying attention to the construction of the power station in South Phyongan Province where there are abundant water power resources and of dynamically accelerating the construction of small and medium-size power stations and clearly indicated the ways for implementing it.
					
					 It highly estimated the members of youth shock brigade, builders and officials in the South Phyongan Province who built the power station by giving full place to the spirit of devotedly implementing the party's policy with gem-like loyalty and noble moral obligation for the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 An inaugural address was followed by speeches to take pledge.

articles.title: Students Meet to Vow Loyalty
articles.content:
Students Meet to Vow Loyalty
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Students gathered at Kim Il Sung University Tuesday to pledge loyalty to Marshal Kim Jong Un to glorify the exploits of leader Kim Jong Il during his revolutionary activities at the university and to uphold Kim Jong Un's idea and leadership. 
					 Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the youth league, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said Kim Jong Il's admission to the university on September 1, Juche 49 (1960) was a great event that firmly guaranteed the future of the revolutionary cause of Juche, the revolutionary cause of Songun and the future of the country.
					
					 Regarding it as his lifetime mission to successfully accomplish the revolutionary cause of President Kim Il Sung generation after generation, Kim Jong Il developed in depth the treasure house of the revolutionary idea of the Workers' Party of Korea during his revolutionary activities at the university and fully demonstrated his great personality and quality as the outstanding leader, they said, and went on:
					
					 Over more than half a century he led the Korean revolution to victory and glory, turning the country into a political and ideological power, a powerful nuclear weapons state and a military power and ushering in a great heyday of national prosperity unprecedented in the nation's history spanning 5 000 years.
					
					 They called for working hard to bring earlier the final victory in the drive for building a thriving nation in the revolutionary spirit of Paektu, the spirit of blizzards of Paektu under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, true to the intention of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Present at the meeting were Thae Hyong Chol, president of Kim Il Sung University and minister of Higher Education, officials of the youth league and students.

articles.title: DPRK Team Comes First at 19th World Taekwon-do Championships
articles.content:
DPRK Team Comes First at 19th World Taekwon-do Championships
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The DPRK team bagged four trophies, 16 gold medals, four silvers and five bronzes to come first in the countries' standings at the 19th World Taekwon-do Championships. 
					 The championships held in Plovdiv City of Bulgaria from August 24 to 30 brought together more than 380 men and women players from 81 countries. 
					
					 The DPRK team took the first place in the men's and women's team pattern competitions, team sparring matches and self-defense matches. 
					
					 Gold medals went to Ri Chung Il and Han Song Min in the men's individual first and second degree pattern competitions, Rim Wi Sok in men's 64kg individual sparring matches, Kim Su Ryon in the women's individual second degree pattern competitions and women's 75kg individual sparring matches, Kim Hyang Sim in the women's individual third degree pattern competitions, Ri Un Jong, Sin Jong Hwa and Choe Su Ryon in the women's 45kg, 69kg and 75kg and above individual sparring matches and Kim Il Hwa in women's individual special technique competitions. 
					
					 DPRK players came second in men's and women's team special technique competitions. 
					
					 Sin Jong Hwa and Kim Hyang Sim bagged silvers in the women's individual fourth degree pattern competitions and women's 57kg individual sparring matches. 
					
					 Meanwhile, Kim Chol Hak, Han Song Min, Ri Hyon, Pak Mi Hyang and Hwang Su Yong won bronzes in men's 50kg, 78kg and 85kg and above individual sparring matches and women's individual first degree pattern competitions and women's 51kg individual sparring matches.

articles.title: New Fumigant Developed
articles.content:
New Fumigant Developed
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The Korea Kumunsan Trading Corporation has recently developed a solid fumigant of high insecticidal effect.
					 The fumigant is made of apatite, anthracite and other locally available materials, said its developer Pang Chol.
					
					 It is very effectual for preserving historical relics, conserving stuffed specimens and keeping cereals, garments and foodstuff, he said.
					
					 The fumigant was highly estimated at the 30th National Festival of Science and Technology.

articles.title: Silk Mills Boost Production in DPRK
articles.content:
Silk Mills Boost Production in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Technical innovations lead to increased production at silk mills in the DPRK.
					 Taking the lead in technical innovation is Pakchon Silk Mill.
					
					 A number of innovations have been introduced in the processes of producing velvet and blanket, saving manpower and improving the quality of products.
					
					 Weaving, dyeing and other processes have also been upgraded, so as to increase varieties of products and put their production on a diverse and multi-color basis.
					
					 The same is true of Nyongbyon and Anju silk mills.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Bringing U.S. to Human Rights Tribunal
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Bringing U.S. to Human Rights Tribunal 
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The American magazine Foreign Policy disclosed shortly ago that an American soldier who mercilessly killed 16 innocent civilians including children and women in a village in Afghanistan in 2012, shocking the people, used alcohol and drug.
					 The soldier has been known as alcohol and drug addict since long ago. But the U.S. authorities dispatched him to Iraq and Afghanistan.
					
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this brought to light the fact that the U.S. deliberately hurled alcohol and drug addicts into abusing human rights and killing people.
					
					 The commentary cites facts to prove that the U.S. has committed state-sponsored and organized human rights abuses against other countries and nations. 
					
					 This is clearly proved by its man-killings and human rights abuses in various parts of the world under the pretext of "anti-terrorism," the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 GIs' killings of civilians are beyond human imagination.
					
					 Needless to say, the U.S. is the kingpin and chieftain of human rights abuses.
					
					 Whoever abused international law has to face legal punishment in the international arena. 
					
					 The U.S. deserves punishment at the international human rights tribunal for its human rights abuses.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Improving North-South Relations
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Improving North-South Relations
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- It is the stand of the DPRK to improve the inter-Korean relations through dialogue and cooperation, not confrontation, and pave the road of peace and prosperity of the nation, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The north and the south should advance the inter-Korean relations in the constructive direction of aspiring after reunification as expected and wished by all Koreans, not confined to overcoming the extreme crisis.
					
					 The acute confrontation between the north and the south is not defused of itself with the passage of time. They should put a definite end to the vicious cycle of repetition of crisis by their concerted efforts.
					
					 It is important to sincerely honor the north-south agreement to this end.  
					
					 The implementation of the above-said agreement is a way of defusing the danger of a war on the Korean Peninsula and achieving the independent reunification, peace and prosperity through national reconciliation and unity.
					
					 No one has the right to violate the north-south agreement which they promised to implement before the nation. 
					
					 Whether the inter-Korean relations are repaired or not entirely depends on what attitude the north and the south take to settle issues.
					
					 Efforts to mend the inter-Korean relations and confrontation can never go together.
					
					 There can be no atmosphere of improving the inter-Korean relations as long as provocations and mud-slinging at the other side are going on because they will only stoke contradiction and antagonism. 
					
					 When such practices reach their height, they cannot but lead to a war between the north and the south. This is the lesson drawn by all Koreans once again from the recent crisis.
					
					 The north and the south should solve issues in conformity with wishes and interests common to the nation, aware that they are responsible for settling the issues of the nation and reunification, and thus make pooling efforts in the spirit of By Our Nation Itself a trend of the history of the nation.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Accuses U.S. of Posing Nuclear Threat to World and Proliferating Nukes
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Accuses U.S. of Posing Nuclear Threat to World and Proliferating Nukes
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed by a U.S. internet newssite recently that the U.S. had pushed forward a plan to drop 12 more A bombs on 12 cities of Japan hard to destroy with ordinary bombs for the purpose of verifying "A bomb effect" after dropping A bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki during the Pacific War.
					 According to what was discussed by military experts on August 13, 1945, the third A bomb, more powerful than those dropped earlier, was standing by in the Mariana Islands and 12 more A bombs including that were under an additional dropping plan.
					
					 The U.S. drop of A bombs, the first nuclear disaster against mankind, was monstrous human rights abuses.
					
					 About 700 000 people in Hiroshima and Nagasaki fell victim to the drop of A bombs.
					
					 Even today thousands of people have to receive the treatment of the diseases resulting from radioactive rays among the survivors of the A-bombing. 
					
					 However, the U.S. dropping of A-bombs has not yet been brought to an international military tribunal.
					
					 Recently the speaker of the State Duma of Russia asserted the need to refer the U.S. dropping of A-bombs on Japan to an international military tribunal, adding that no statute of limitation is applicable to the hideous crimes against humanity.
					
					 The U.S. is a nuclear war criminal and chiefly to blame for posing a nuclear threat to the world and proliferating nukes in it.
					
					 The U.S. is styling itself a proactive player in the world denuclearization and a model in nuclear disarmament, talking volumes about "a world without nuclear weapons". But it is steadily modernizing its nuclear arsenal, pursuing with increased zeal its scenario to dominate the world with nukes. It is busy developing and producing new type nuclear weapons, conducting ceaseless concealed nuclear tests. 
					
					 The U.S. keeps proliferating nukes as evidenced by its recognition of Israel's access to nukes and discussion on a proposal for stepping up the nuclear weaponization with the member states of NATO in breach of the spirit of the NPT. 
					
					 It is speeding up the development and modernization of nukes under the pretext of denuclearization.
					
					 It is mulling investing a trillion U.S. dollars for modernizing nuclear weapons in nearly 30 years to come.
					
					 Last year it made the biggest financial allocation for the research, development and trial production of nukes since the 1950s. It is contemplating investing 355 billion U.S. dollars for modernizing nuclear warheads in nearly 10 years to come.
					
					 It built a base for producing new type weapon grade plutonium and nuclear test ground in Los Alamos, New Mexico State, and started enriching uranium in a new facility in Tennessee State.
					
					 It is refusing to ratify the CTBT while pushing forward the establishment of a global MD system and the project to put its "conception of prompt global strike" into practice.
					
					 Washington's nuclear policy sparked a race for nuclear weapons development and manufacture in the international arena and, consequently, the world is exposed to increasing danger of a nuclear war.
					
					 No one can vouch that such tragedy as what happened in Hiroshima and Nagasaki will not repeat itself as long as Washington continues to brandish nuclear weapons
					
					 The U.S. can never evade the responsibility for bringing the dark clouds of a nuclear war to hang over humankind.

articles.title: Japan Flailed for Setting up New Site on Tok Islets
articles.content:
Japan Flailed for Setting up New Site on Tok Islets
						
Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Japan has become all the more undisguised in its moves to grab Tok Islets.
					Kukmin Ilbo of south Korea said the Japanese government on August 28 opened a site for data related to Tok Islets including old administrative documents that reflect Japan's unilateral "dominium on Tok Islets".
					
					Japan's distortion of history and its moves to grab Tok Islets are a prelude to the reinvasion of the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: S. Korean People Stage Action after 500 Days from Sewol Sinking Disaster
articles.content:
S. Korean People Stage Action after 500 Days from Sewol Sinking Disaster
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- More than 2 000 people of all social standings of the Consultative Council of Families of Victims for Probing Truth about April 16 Ferry Sewol Disaster and Building Safe Society and other organizations and from different areas in south Korea held a rally for honoring the memory of victims at Seoul Railway Station on August 29, 500 days since the occurrence of the ferry Sewol disaster.
					 Speakers deplored that an objective and independent investigation has not yet been made though 500 days have passed.
					
					 The "government" is busy urging the bereaved families to overcome sorrow at an early date, far from taking measures to console and prevent the recurrence of the disaster, they said.
					
					 They can no longer remain passive onlookers but carry on their actions for the dead children, they stressed.
					
					 At the end of the rally the participants marched as far as Kwanghwamun Plaza and held a memorial service there.
					
					 The bereaved family members and other citizens distributed copies of literature demanding probe into the truth.

articles.title: S. Korean Police Officer Shoots His Subordinate to Death
articles.content:
S. Korean Police Officer Shoots His Subordinate to Death 
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- A police officer shot his subordinate to death in south Korea, according to the MBC of south Korea on August 28.
					 A police officer threatened at a gunpoint a man on his guard duty at a checkpoint in a place in Seoul recently, complaining he had snacks without him and in the end opened fire, killing him.
					
					 The officer had a record of threatening his subordinates several times at gunpoint.
					
					 As soon as the incident occurred, the police authorities charged him with only a suspicion of murder by mistake that is attributable to his lack of knowledge about gun-related rules.
					
					 The broadcasting service held that the upper echelon of the police should not handle the incident as an issue pertaining to the officer alone.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days Marked Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days Marked Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- There took place Korean book, photo and art exhibitions in Peru and China and a photo exhibition in Nigeria from August 18 to 26 on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation, the 55th Day of Songun and the 67th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					 Displayed at the venues of events were photos documenting the exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were their works, books on their greatness, books and photos introducing Songun Korea and art pieces showing the good qualities of the Korean nation.

articles.title: Korea's Liberation Day Marked in Hungary, Venezuela
articles.content:
Korea's Liberation Day Marked in Hungary, Venezuela 
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Hungarian and Venezuelan newspapers carried special write-ups to mark the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation. 
					 The Hungarian paper Liberation on August 15 said that during the occupation of Korea the Japanese imperialists plundered Korea of everything and killed more than a million Koreans. Moreover, they tried to assimilate the Koreans to Japanese. 
					
					 However, the Japanese imperialists were defeated by the anti-Japanese armed struggle led by President Kim Il Sung and the Korean people greeted the day of liberation, the paper noted. 
					
					 The Korean people freed from the colonial yoke of the Japanese imperialists turned out in the drive for building a new country, it said, adding:
					
					 The Workers' Party of Korea founded by him led the people to the building of a new country. 
					
					 It victoriously led the Fatherland Liberation War to protect the sovereignty of the country from the U.S. imperialists and encouraged the service personnel and people in the dynamic drive for the postwar rehabilitation and construction and socialist construction in unity. 
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un is now arousing the service personnel and people of the DPRK to the drive for building a thriving socialist nation. 
					
					 The Venezuelan internet paper Aporea on August 18 in an article laid bare barbarities committed by the Japanese imperialists during the occupation of Korea. It said the reality of the DPRK makes the people recollect once again the significance of Korea's liberation which brought about a turning point in carving out the independent destiny of the popular masses and achieving the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Nigerian Organization Denounces U.S. and S. Korean Authorities for Their Reckless Moves
articles.content:
Nigerian Organization Denounces U.S. and S. Korean Authorities for Their Reckless Moves
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted an article on its website on August 22.
					 The article said that the tension on the Korean Peninsula is escalating day by day due to the war moves of the U.S. and south Korean authorities.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The DPRK never pardons the aggressors.
					
					 It frustrated the U.S. imperialists' every move to ignite a war of aggression as evidenced by the capture of the armed spy ship Pueblo and shooting down of the large spy plane EC-121.
					
					 It had access to even powerful nuclear deterrence to cope with the U.S. arrogantly working for aggression, threatening it with nuclear weapons.
					
					 The enemies of the DPRK should clearly know that it values its sovereignty and dignity more than anything else and has the will and capability for mercilessly punishing those who attempt to invade it, no matter where they are in our planet.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean authorities should stop running recklessly to invade the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK never makes an empty talk.

articles.title: U.S. Imperialists' Moves for Aggression against DPRK under Fire in Bulgaria
articles.content:
U.S. Imperialists' Moves for Aggression against DPRK under Fire in Bulgaria 
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The August 1-15 issues of the Bulgarian paper Novo Rabotnichesko Delo carried articles under the caption "Month of solidarity with Korean people."
					 Noting progressive mankind is observing the period between June 25 and July 27 every year as month of anti-U.S. joint struggle or month of solidarity with the Korean people, the paper said:
					
					 The West is conducting false propaganda that the DPRK ignited the Korean war.
					
					 But all historical facts prove that the U.S. imperialists provoked the war.
					
					The paper introduced in detail the fact that the service personnel and people of the DPRK resolutely beat back the invasion by the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 Referring to the signal successes made by the service personnel and people of the DPRK and the heavy setbacks the U.S. sustained in the whole period of the war, the paper continued:
					
					 More than 60 years have passed since the ceasefire but the war wounds have not been healed.
					
					 An armistice agreement, not a peace treaty, was concluded and both sides are, therefore, technically at war on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists have not yet withdrawn their forces from south Korea but have staged ceaseless large-scale war drills with even nuclear strike means involved every year, straining the situation on the peninsula.
					
					 That's why the world progressive people are censuring their moves for aggression and extending support and solidarity to the Korean people in their efforts to achieve their just cause.
					
					 The Korean people are staging a nation-wide struggle to force the U.S. imperialists, a source of misfortune of the nation and the danger of war, out of south Korea this year, the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.

articles.title: Day of Songun Observed by British Bodies
articles.content:
Day of Songun Observed by British Bodies
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea released a joint statement on August 18 to observe the 55th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 The statement said that Generalissimo Kim Jong Il inspected the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Tank Division of the Korean People's Army on August 25, 1960, a solemn declaration of succession to the revolutionary cause of Songun.
					
					 He performed undying exploits by weathering out the stern tempest of history with his outstanding idea and extraordinary leadership for a long period since he started the Songun revolution, true to the noble intention of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 When the Korean revolution faced the worst trial, Kim Jong Il formulated the Songun politics as a main political mode under socialism and comprehensively embodied it.
					
					 He developed the Korean People's Army into an invincible revolutionary army.
					
					 The 55th anniversary of his start of the Songun revolutionary leadership carries greater significance as it is being greeted by the Korean people at a time when they celebrate the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation achieved by them through an anti-Japanese armed struggle under the leadership of Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Exploits Praised Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Exploits Praised Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Various events took place in foreign countries to mark the 55th anniversary of  leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership. 
					 They included a seminar on his work in Romania, seminar on his exploits and photo exhibition in Bulgaria, meeting in Ecuador and meeting and book exhibition in Germany from August 18 to 24. 
					
					 On display at the venues of the events were photos documenting exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and their works, and books on their greatness and other books introducing Songun Korea. 
					
					 The chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania explained the gist of Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution". He said that Kim Jong Il systematized and developed in depth the Songun revolutionary idea through Songun leadership, providing not only the Korean people but the world revolutionary people with guidelines and a banner for sure victory in accomplishing the cause of global independence. 
					
					 The honorary chairman of the Bulgarian Communists Union, the secretary general of the Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association and other speakers said thanks to the significant Day of Songun the history and tradition of the Songun revolution of Korea, which started and victoriously advanced with arms, are given steady continuity. 
					
					 The chairman of the Guaranda Association for Friendship, Culture and Solidarity with the Korean People of Ecuador said that the world progressives will always remember the exploits Kim Jong Il performed by protecting with Songun politics the sovereignty of the nation and saving the destiny of socialism from the imperialists' moves to stifle the DPRK. 
					
					 The chairman of the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany said the DPRK could weather all tests of history and emerge a nuclear weapons state and space power as Kim Jong Il followed the Songun politics as a basic political mode under socialism and dynamically pushed forward the revolution and construction with the Korean People's Army as a mainstay and driving force.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un visita Fabrica de Procesamiento de Maiz de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un visita Fabrica de Procesamiento de Maiz de Pyongyang
						
Pyongyang, 1 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un dirigio en el terreno la Fabrica de Procesamiento de Maiz de Pyongyang nuevamente construida.
					Contemplando el panorama de la fabrica, el dijo con satisfaccion que con el levantamiento de la fabrica en medio de las llamaradas de la creacion del nuevo espiritu de Pyongyang, la velocidad de Pyongyang, se llevo a feliz termino otro legado del Dirigente Kim Jong Il quien dedico ingentes esfuerzos y abnegacion a la mejora de vida alimentaria de los ciudadanos.
					
					Pasando revista a varios procesos de produccion y salas de exhibicion de productos, control general, divulgacion de ciencias y tecnicas y analisis de ensayo y el gimnasio bajo techo, se cercioro en detalles del estado de construccion y produccion.
					
					Se satisfizo diciendo que la fabrica ha aumentado las variedades de los productos procesados de maiz tales como fideo, semola de maiz, galleta, pan, jalea, etc. y mejorado el nivel de embalaje de las mercancias.
					
					Ademas, evaluo altamente que la fabrica acondiciono bien la sala de divulgacion de ciencias y tecnicas con capacidad de recibir la tele-educacion y el gimnasio bajo techo.
					
					Acoto que la fabrica tiene la importante mision de hacer aporte al mejoramiento de vida alimentaria de los pyongyaneses. Y aclaro las tareas y remedios de la fabrica para producir gran cantidad de diferentes productos procesados de maiz mediante la normalizacion en el alto nivel de la produccion, tomar correctamente las medidas de aseguramiento de materias primas, organizar con escrupulosidad la administracion empresarial, prestar la mayor atencion a observar estrictamente la seguridad higienica y la calidad de las mercancias y hacer que todas las mercancias de la fabrica ganen gran reputacion de los consumidores. 
					
					Aprecio altamente las proezas de los pyongyaneses quienes dedicaron toda su sinceridad a la construccion de la fabrica y de los funcionarios, profesores e investigadores de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, la Universidad Politecnica Kim Chaek, la Universidad de Maquinaria de Pyongyang y la Universidad de Industria Ligera Han Tok Su de Pyongyang quienes hicieron gran aporte a modernizarla.
					
					Manifesto la esperanza y conviccion de que los funcionarios y empleados de la fabrica glorificaran para siempre el ardiente amor por el pueblo del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il y tomo foto de recuerdo junto con ellos.
					
					El Mariscal fue acompanado por Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Yang Gon y Jo Yong Won.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita Dia Nacional de Uzbekistan
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita Dia Nacional de Uzbekistan
						
Pyongyang, 1 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia primero un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Uzbekistan, Islam Karimov, con motivo del Dia Nacional de este pais.
					Convencido de que las relaciones de amistad entre Corea y Uzbekistan se desarrollen favorablemente conforme a los intereses de los pueblos de los dos paises, el remitente desea al destinatario exitos en sus labores responsables para la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Mitin por 55o aniversario de establecimiento de relaciones diplomaticas entre RPDC y Cuba
articles.content:
Mitin por 55o aniversario de establecimiento de relaciones diplomaticas entre RPDC y Cuba
						
Pyongyang, 1 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia primero en la capitalina Casa Cultural Chollima el mitin dedicado al 55o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Republica de Cuba.
					Al acto fueron invitados el embajador German Hermin Ferras Alvarez y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica de Cuba en la RPDC.
					
					Estuvieron presentes alli el presidente del Comite de Educacion, Kim Sung Du, presidente del Comite Coreano de Solidaridad con Cuba, el vicecanciller Sin Hong Chol, el vicepresidente del Comite de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, So Ho Won, y otros funcionarios coreanos junto con los trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					En su discurso, Kim Sung Du recordo que bajo la destacada direccion de los companeros Fidel Castro Ruz y Raul Castro Ruz, el pueblo cubano ha defendido con firmeza la soberania del pais e impulsado con exito la revolucion y la construccion, frustrando las perversas maniobras de EE.UU. tendiente a aislar y aplastar a Cuba.
					
					Subrayo que en lo adelante tambien el pueblo coreano considerara al pueblo cubano como intimo companero de armas que se halla en primera linea de la lucha antiimperialista y antiyanqui y hara ingentes esfuerzos por desarrollar mas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre ambos paises.
					
					En su discurso, el embajador cubano menciono que el Presidente Kim Il Sung envio el incontable apoyo y respaldo a Cuba cuando sufria crisis del Caribe y subrayo que las relaciones de amistad entre ambos paises, preparadas y fortalecidas por los lideres antecedentes, se heredan y se desarrollan mas gracias al Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					Deseo al pueblo coreano que conquiste las grandiosas metas de la construccion de un potente Estado prospero y logre la reunificacion de la patria y formulo votos por fortalecer mas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises.

articles.title: Levantada en embajada cubana sala de conservacion de carro regalado por Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Levantada en embajada cubana sala de conservacion de carro regalado por Kim Il Sung
						
Pyongyang, 1 de septiembre (ACNC) -- En la Embajada de la Republica de Cuba acreditada en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea se acondiciono nuevamente la sala de conservacion del carro regalado por el Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					Al prestar profunda atencion al desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad con el pueblo cubano, el Presidente envio el 51 (1962) de la era Juche, un carro al primer embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Republica de Cuba en Corea, Lazaro Vigoa.
					
					Para transmitir eternamente la noble obligacion internacional del Presidente, el gobierno cubano hizo guardar en forma original ese carro en la embajada cubana en Corea con motivo del Dia del Sol en el ano 1999.
					
					En acato al proposito del gobierno y el pueblo de Cuba que conceden gran importancia al desarrollo de las tradicionales relaciones de amistad con la RPDC, la embajada cubana lo conserva cortesmente hasta la fecha y acondiciono nuevamente la sala de conservacion de dicho carro este ano en que se cumple el 55o aniversario del establecimiento de relaciones diplomaticas entre los dos paises. 
					
					Tuvo lugar el dia 31 la ceremonia de inauguracion de la sala de conservacion del carro regalado.
					
					En la ocasion fueron invitados el canciller Ri Su Yong, el subjefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Pak Kun Gwang, el director general de la Direccion General de Trabajo con el Cuerpo Diplomatico, Sim Kuk Ryong, el vicepresidente del Comite de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, So Ho Won y otros funcionarios de la rama correspondiente.
					
					Estuvieron presentes el embajador German Hermin Ferras Alvarez y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica de Cuba.
					
					El embajador cubano subrayo que la sala de conservacion del carro regalado construida excelentemente sirve de simbolo de la amistad y la solidaridad especiales y cordiales entre Cuba y Corea.
					
					Y expreso conviccion de que el carro regalado se guardara para siempre en la embajada cubana para mostrar a las nuevas generaciones la invencibilidad de las relaciones de amistad entre ambos paises.
					
					Los participantes vieron el carro regalado.
